greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: After A084937(n) has been computed, let m = largest term so far in A084937. Then a(n) = number of positive even integers < m that are missing from A084937 at this point.
comment: Running count of missing even numbers in A084937.
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100000
example: After step 7 of A084937, here is what we have:
so m = 9, and the missing even numbers < 9 are 6 and 8, so a(7) = 2.
xref: Cf. A084937, A249686, A250100. See A249777, A249856, A249857 for another way of looking at this question.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 12 2014
